alert.note: Alert for Merced (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 9:56AM PDT until April 18 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Stevinson affecting Merced County. For the Merced River...including Stevinson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Stevinson. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 70.5 feet, Water is up to the maintenance building in Hagaman Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Monday the stage was 70.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 71.0 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 71.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 71.4 feet on 03/21/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Location Fld Observed Forecasts (10 am PDT) -------- Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Merced River Stevinson 71.0 70.4 Mon 8 am PDT 71.0 70.7 70.6 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM PDT.
